title: Erasing Fears & Traumas Based on the Modern Neuroscience of Fear

questions.question: What brain region is primarily involved in the threat reflex and fear response?
questions.explanation: The amygdala is a critical component of the threat reflex, which activates the fear response.

questions.question: How does Dr. Huberman recommend replacing fear in therapeutic settings?

options.text: By replacing it with new, positive associations
By exposing oneself to the fear repeatedly

questions.explanation: Dr. Huberman emphasizes that to extinguish fear, it must be replaced with new, positive associations rather than eliminated.

questions.question: What is the relationship between social connections and trauma according to recent findings?

options.text: Social connections have no effect on trauma
Social connections can reduce the effects of trauma and fear
Social connections only help with physical health

questions.explanation: Research indicates that social connections lower levels of Tachykinin, which can exacerbate anxiety and trauma responses.
